Steps don't update in together or in a challenge unless you keep logging in. In a challenge, the "lost by" amount for steps states the steps for the day prior and not the correct steps. Additionally, my mother shouldn't be able to "shake" her phone to get 200,000 steps in 3 days. Couldn't you create a pop-up that says, "Wow! You are running faster than a cheetah!" and time that woman out!? For running, I wish it would keep track of my "best records" Besides that, I love the features this app has!

It is pretty good, but it could be better. I would like it more if there was a way to track measurements as well as weight and if there was a way to add pedometer steps manually for those of use using a different one. I think there should also be a way to record caffeine content of foods in the nutrition details instead of having to remember to record it separately. It would be nice to be able to record if I take a nap or my sleep gets interrupted under the sleep section.

reviewTitle: The app worked very well. Unfortunately, I had to uninstall. It caused my phone to have issues with unlocking, answering calls and it caused my phone to freeze up. I guess it doesn't like the Note 9. Also, the alerts weren't loud enough. I kept missing them. I would love this app and reinstall if those bugs were fixed, more alert sound options, and ESPECIALLY if there was a 'snooze' option because I can't always drop everything and run to get a drink when an alert would go off.

The only issue I have is the leaderboard for the challenges. It is obvious that people are abusing the system, logging in excesses over 100,000 steps a day (about 50 miles). Some have even made a mockery out of it to prove a point.

My first fitbit lasted a short time until the charge port fell apart. A replacement did the same. Bought a Charge 3 for myself and my wife to use with a Motorola E4 plus, hers set up mine would not.   I called them and danced around for about an hour until the lady said it was not compatible with the Motorola E 4 (this was before we tried my wife's) buy I was able to see the time and steps and resigned myself to that use.  Just for kicks we tired to set up my wife's and wala it worked but mine still would not. I lived with it until I traveled and found out it would not change time zones.   I called them again and after another hour of play was told again it would not work so I asked it I could use my laptop to set it up and the answer was yes, but it too would not set up so that said it was not a cell phone problem but a fitbit problem at which time she said because we uninstalled the app and reinstalled that was causing the problem which they are working on and to call back in a week??????????  However, in the hour process she had me restart the fitbit which I now discovered set the watch to 12 am and there it sits.. so now I only have a step counter

So if you're watching a live stream or videos, the notification will ruin it and throw you ads on top of it. Edit: so last night I had 2600/2630 ml, I got between 60-80% completed. Today, before drinking anything, 1200 ml.

Synch issues with Blaze on Android: Step 1 - uninstall the app. Step 2 - re-install the app. Step 3 - shut down your phone Step 4 - wait 15 seconds Step 5 - turn on phone Step 6 - turn off Blaze (classic) on your Fitbit tracker settings Worked fine after that!

So sorry to give such a bad review. but I do hope this helps someone else. This is my second ionic. The first one stop working and the screen kept flashing. I was grateful Fitbit did replace. I was surprised they only sent me the Fitbit not new bands. I thought that was kind of weird. For the price we paid. Now I am constantly having problems syncing my device. I am getting messages saying my tracker is not responding. I imagine if I called the company  they may send me another one  but truthfully  after the third one  I don't want to see Fitbit anymore .  There are so many devices that do the same thing  cheaper faster better . I am also let down bye the size of the ionic and limited number of features, and exceptionally limited number of apps. Battery life is terrible I need to charge it most days. Sort of like Fitbit was trying to make the ionic look  like  and Apple watch. Surprise. I'm done with Fitbit.

This app and watch just sucks and now it can’t even suck because it just stopped working. Won’t charge, won’t turn on and apparently, this is a regular occurrence with these watches and about the only people on earth that don’t know this, are the employees at Samsung.  I would go for a run and after 45 minutes the watch would report my BPM at 220. Stop, wipe off the watch and bam, back to 140.  Turns out, if you sweat when you work out, the watch doesn’t work. Get a call and the watch goes into a different display mode and you have to literally stop and reset the damned watch to display/track your progress. Then there’s this stupid NOTICE: after the watch figures out you have been exercising for 10 minutes, it displays a message and tries to force you to go into the settings and set the automatic sensor for workouts. Problem is: the automatic workout senor was already on and you cannot simply push a single button and get your workout data back. This app and watch just suck

Great if it was accurate. I used to put it against my Fitbit but it was off .25 miles. So I included map my walk to find out where the problem was. It was Samsung Health that was off. That's the only thing stopping me from getting a Samsung fitness watch. Disappointing!

The app auto stops when I start running almost always stops around 0.4 kms. For weeks now, even took it to Samsung, they couldn't help. Even map wont record. So it's not really useful when running. It records all the steps perfectly when walking, gives blood pressure reading accurately but the one function I need from it is malfunctioning.

While I like the app in general, and used it for months w phone only, I'm disappointed the wearable device I could finally actually afford [& worked well enough for limited abilities], wasn't one compatible with it. I have been a Fitbit owner since 2014-15. I love having my Fitbit
App is really good in the main.
This app works fairly well. At times I've had trouble getting it to "synch" and I don't get notifications of calls or messages on my Fitbit as frequently as I should.
love!
it's fun
love this app..... helps me try to get healthier

I thoroughly enjoy Fitbit. The challenges and the rewards. it is motivation to move. I'm not a runner and I'm not fast but it is about doing it. Just walk and experience the joy of moving at my own pace for my well being.
Easy to follow instructions along with your smart phone.

Most recent update broke the widget. Now I only get a blank space and eventually a popup with "fitbit has stopped working" (LG G6). System and app cache clear hasn't fixed the broken widget. The new interface is obnoxious to find/edit my silent alarms, which is about 2/3 of the reason why I have a fitbit. I don't want to have to troll through 4 menus to do that. Sometimes the app can't find my charge 2, and I have to completely reinstall it.
The best out there!
slow
tt
This is what inspires me every day and keeps me going. The Steps! My cardiologist said that this is one of the best devices that he has ever heard of. 💖

After the update it's showing "today" as the date 6 days ago. It's a Saturday and it's only giving me things from last Sunday. Please fix this, or undo the new coding. Really disappointing, because I love this app. I uninstalled and downloaded it again and this was still the issue.
Fitbit best thing ever never leave home without it, would recommend to buy one

This app is actually not too bad. However, I have a Fitbit Ionic that refuses to pair with Bluetooth earphones. My third set stopped pairing after a couple of weeks, once it stops, it never pairs again. Don't buy a Fitbit if you want to use Bluetooth earphones.
excellent App
For the past week or so my versa will not stay connected been fab up until then

I have used this app for years and loved it. On my new S10 it would only work for a little while and then the oxygen reading would only show 70. After several phone calls with Samsung I ended up getting a new S10. To my surprise the same thing happened again. What I ended up figuring out is another app I use, My BP Lab (also associated with Samsung) was causing Samsung health to not work correctly. As long as you didn't use My BP Lab the health app worked correctly but if you used it once then the health app was messed up until you restarted the phone. Due to the connection between these two apps I would think that they should be able to work together.

Total rubbish! The app is utterly useless.  1. Poorly designed interface. When launching the app for the first time, you are asked whether you wish to log in or create an account. If you choose to create a new account, the subsequent screen looks like a log-in screen requesting your email and password. There is no option to re-enter the password to ensure you typed it correctly both times.  2. Progressing past this screen, you select the Fitbit model you have, and try to pair it with your phone or tablet via Bluetooth. The app says the screen of your Fitbit must be on, yet the app detects the FitBit without the screen being on. Pointless instruction.  3. This is the issue that  wipes out any possibility of this being a 2 or 3 star app. After entering the pairing code, the app simply cannot connect to my Fitbit. It tries, reports that the setup routine is taking longer than normal, and keeps trying. And trying. And trying. And trying. But no connection is ever made.  Essentially, all I have on my wrist is an over-priced pedometer. I cannot track any of my workouts, my sleep, or view any statistics.

appTitle: Drink Water Reminder: Water Tracker & Alarm
reviewTitle: I have no natural thirst, so I'm constantly dehydrated. I know it's important to drink water, but I forget to do it. This app is great: it reminds me on my phone to drink X ounces every so often throughout the day (you set the amount). If you have the same problem remembering to drink water, this app is for you.

Device not receiving notifications?? in my case, it was because each time my phone would sleep, it would disconnect the service been the app and the device. i struggled with my device and worked with support for weeks! Neither Fitbit, nor Huawei support could find the problem, but here is the solution!! - go into settings >battery >More battery settings >>stay connected when Device sleeps.... that easy! my fitbit finally receives notifications!

Charge Your Inspire page doesn't say what to plug the charging cable into.  Sure won't be my phone as it doesn't have a full size USB plug. Was it searching for Bluetooth?  My phone found the Inspire HR but failed to pair with it.  Many times.    My laptop has a USB plug so I tried to run the App on my Windows 10 laptop.  No version of the app was found that runs on Windows 10.

reviewTitle: Good but slight improvements required!! (Paid version) E.g. Once the reminder shows on screen, later moves the notification away but drink option should not open the app and record. It would be great to have ALL of my relevant health information in one place instead of having to go back & forth between apps.

appTitle: Drink Water Reminder: Water Tracker & Alarm
reviewTitle: Great jumpstart app!! This app allows you to choose your own reminder times, fl oz and your personal metrics. I think the recommended fl is a little high but it jump starts you're intake. I did it for 2 weeks and I became extremely bloated. On my 3rd week I put it down to a realistic fl and I easily lost all of my water weight! If you pair this with a workout plan, (it doesn't have to be extreme) you'll reap serious benefits. I've already lost 5lbs not including the water weight I've lost. Thx!!

Samsung Health could take some lessons from Fitbit. One of the main features that's helpful with Fitbit is the ability to edit sleep time (the Galaxy Watch ALWAYS gets it wrong - I've started charging the watch at night and sleeping with my Fitbit), and active time. Fitbit also has very detailed sleep stats. My watch stopped counting steps yesterday. Then today it said I was active between 12am-3am and counted a lot of steps. My watch was on the charger at that time! There's no way to edit it.

The GPS on my phone is working correctly - checked by another GPS app and if I start another fitness app (Runkeeper), it records the activity and maps the route correctly.  Hopefully the next update will solve this problem

There is one extremely annoying part about this app: 1. I add a food. 2. It takes me back to the diary page, and the food I just added slides into the display. So far so good. 3. Sometimes it will try to show an additional message, like "This food has lots of Vitamin C". 4. As I reach for the button to add another food, that additional message appears after a brief delay, and instead of hitting the "Add food" button, I hit the food I just added and it takes me to the page to edit that food.  That additional message doesn't always appear, so the result is a change to the interface that moves the button I am trying to hit. Worse, that change is unpredictable and inconsistent. After adding a food, the logical next step is to add another food item, so don't move that button. Please fix this!

Is there an option that takes medical issues into account?
